bibl.title: Theatrical Fiction and Visual Bilingualism in the Monumental Tombs of Ptolemaic Egypt.

series.title: Aarhus Studies in Mediterranean Antiquity. ASMA.

bibl.note: Two seemingly disparate elements contribute to the singularity of Alexandrian tombs: 1. The incorporation of Egyptian elements into the fabric of initially and fundamentally Hellenic-inspired monuments; - 2. Their inclusion of theatre.

bibl.title: Alexandria. A Cultural and Religious Melting Pot

bibl.seg: VENIT Marjorie Susan, Theatrical Fiction and Visual Bilingualism in the Monumental Tombs of Ptolemaic Egypt.
George HINGE and Jens A. KRASILNIKOFF (Edd.), Alexandria. A Cultural and Religious Melting Pot = Aarhus Studies in Mediterranean Antiquity. ASMA. 9 (Aarhus, 2009) pp. 42-64, 13 figg.

Two seemingly disparate elements contribute to the singularity of Alexandrian tombs: 1. The incorporation of Egyptian elements into the fabric of initially and fundamentally Hellenic-inspired monuments; - 2. Their inclusion of theatre.
